person.persName: Lewis Saunders Slayden (Graves County farmer, soldier, and prov govt)

body.p: Graves County, Kentucky, farmer, soldier, and provisional government convention member. Kentucky native. Son of T. A. Slayden and Letitia Slayden. Resident of Graves County in 1850. Farmer in Graves County in 1860. Member of the convention of the provisional government held at Russellville in November 1861. Served in the 2nd Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) as a captain from July 13, 1861 to December 13, 1862.
